definition: to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: She set off on a journey to obtain a potent medicinal herb, which could revive her husband.
sentences.chinese: 因此白蛇外出寻找能使许仙起死回生的强效药草。

sentences.english: Can the Pakistani government's web of deceit survive the death of Osama bin Laden?
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦政府的谎言之网能让拉登起死回生吗？

sentences.english: A good teacher is good luck of a student.
sentences.chinese: 好老师有起死回生的力量，是学生的幸运之星。

sentences.english: The old witch said she could raise the dead.
sentences.chinese: 老巫婆说她能起死回生。

sentences.english: It is said that this medicine can resurrect the dead.
sentences.chinese: 据说这种药能起死回生。

sentences.english: A while ago Gles was a well-known witch-doctor capable of curing even the most horrible wounds.
sentences.chinese: 格雷丝在过去是一位能起死回生的知名巫医。

sentences.english: We buy insurance for just about everything including our life but money can never bring life back.
sentences.chinese: 我们买所有的保险包括人生保险，但钱不能起死回生。

definition: to bring back to life
magical hands bring the dying back to life (idiom); miracle cure/brilliant doctor
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to be reborn/rebirth
lit. to change something rotten into something magical (idiom)
pinyin: hua4 fu3 xiu3 wei2 shen2 qi2

definition: effective cure, miracle medicine (idiom); fig. wonder-cure for all problems/panacea/elixir
to return from the grave/(old) to recycle (waste products)
return of spring
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to rise from the ashes (idiom)/to thrive again after surviving an ordeal
to revive/(lit. and fig.) to come back to life/(religion) resurrection
to save/to remedy/to rescue

place sb on a field of death and he will fight to live (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to fight desperately when confronting mortal danger/fig. to find a way out of an impasse
pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1

definition: to save/to rescue
